overview_of_class: This course is an introduction to human anatomy. Topics include: system approach to anatomical organization; sections of the body; musculoskeletal and nervous systems; embryology development. Lectures are supplemented by selected prosections of human cadavers and dry exercises using bones, models, and computer animations. The course is a lecture based course which measures progress with many weekly quizzes, one midterm, a final exam and a term paper. The anatomy is discussed in a regional format and discusses a region of the anatomy (thorax, abdomen, limbs, etc.) each week.
name: Human Anatomy
subject: BIOL_SCI
